commitResults.messageTitle: app.component.spec.ts: Remove unused class TranslateServiceStub  (#519)
Electron entry script: Move menu definition into a separate module (#537)
commitResults.messageBody:
The CATcher electron app's menu bar is defined directly
within the electron entry script (main.ts).

Let's move the menu bar definition into a
separate module, to help break the entry script
into modular pieces.

commitResults.messageTitle: Electron entry script: Move supporting logic into utility functions (#548)
AuthService: Abstract out logic for setting title (#564)
commitResults.messageBody:
Let's abstract out the logic for setting title into separate methods,
to improve readability.

commitResults.messageTitle: IssueTablesComponent: Add tests for 'fitTitleText' function (#561)
IssuesPendingComponent: Decompose logic for filter (#563)
commitResults.messageBody:
The logical expression for initialising the filter in
IssuesPendingComponent is too long and has no tests.

Let's
* decompose the logical expression to improve readability
* add tests for the filter

commitResults.messageTitle: Header: Rename 'View In Browser' to 'View on GitHub'  (#582)
commitResults.messageBody:
The application allows users to open the current
page on GitHub, through a button titled "View in Browser".
Since the application itself now runs on browsers,
this language might be confusing.

Let's
* Rename the button to 'View on GitHub'
* Update the tooltip to 'View current page on GitHub'

commitResults.messageTitle: Tests: Move duplicated dummyTeam into constants file (#609)
IssuesDataTable: Move issue search into separate module, add tests (#593)
commitResults.messageBody:
Logic for applying search filter to the table of issues is defined 
in a private method within IssuesDataTable.

Moving this logic to another module will improve separation of 
concerns. Adding tests for this logic would help with future
regression testing. 

Let's
* Move logic for search filter to another module
* Add tests for the module

commitResults.messageTitle: IssuePendingComponent: Decompose logical expressions into methods (#592)
commitResults.messageBody:
The logical expression for initialising the filter in
IssuePendingComponent is too long and has no tests.

Let's
* decompose the logical expression to improve readability
* add tests for the filter

commitResults.messageTitle: OAuth: Add state parameter to authentication process (#625)
commitResults.messageBody:
CATcher authentication process does not include a verification
step using an unique state parameter.

Adding this state parameter will improve security, as it will
help to protect users against cross-site request forgery attacks.

Let's add this state verification step to the authentication process.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add more logging to authentication process (#640)
commitResults.messageBody:
Let's add more logging to the authentication process to identify
authentication related issues faster.

commitResults.messageTitle: AuthService: Throw error if pop-up windows are blocked (#647)
commitResults.messageBody:
The authentication window is blocked by default in Safari, causing
users to be stuck on loading screen without any notification.

Showing error message to notify users to enable pop-ups and
then directing them back to the start of authentication will
make our application more user-friendly.

Let's
* Show error message when pop-ups are blocked
* Restart authentication process in this case

commitResults.messageTitle: Browser Mode: Setup E2E testing for Bug-Reporting Phase (#539)
commitResults.messageBody:
* Create separate config for Chrome, Firefox

* Add two test cases for login page

* Rename files

* Update gitignore, to ignore test credentials

* Convert functions to async functions

* Handle OAuth redirect by asking browser to wait for GitHub login page

* Setup mock github service

* Fix existing e2e bug

* Successful use of MockGHService in Test Config

Issue: Previously Authentication was not possible with MockGHService

In Commit: Fixed Authentication and,
 - Setup NPM commands to run the different config environments
 - Successful replacement of GHService with MockGHService for Test
   Config

Todo:
 - Proceed with MockUp of other areas of MockGHService to use with
   E2E Tests.

* Quotation Mark Fix

* Working Auth Bypass Proof-Of-Concept

* Removed direct AuthBypass for MockAuthentication

MockAuth allows for the testing of the login page which can then
proceed to the testing of the other phases as opposed to bypassing
it all together and directly spawning into a phase.

* Login + Issue Loading to Bug Reporting Complete

* Remove Credentials Dependence

* Restructuring e2e Internals in accord. with Protractor Style Guide

* Scaffolding for Tests

- Structured e2e dir in accordance to Protractor Style Guide.
- Set up npm commands for manual suite testing using Protractor
- Modified  npm commands for shortened syntax to launch Ang. Confi
- Modified base config for protractor for suite-based testing
- Basic Testing for BugReportingPhase (checking if page reached
  successfully.

* ng e2e supports suite overriding, removing protractor cmd

* PhaseServices Cleanup

* Code Cleanup in Stubs

* Removal of test.credentials

* Add -o to auto-open browser

* Remove Mocking for AppService

* Remove PhaseServiceMock

* Environment Generation

* Redundant Code Removal from MockGHService

* Removing testing commands from package.json

* Syntatic Cleanup

* Removing Prints

* GHService Syntatic Fixes

* Neater Import Structuring

* Remove spaces in Auth Service

Co-authored-by: anubh-v <anubhav@u.nus.edu>

commitResults.messageTitle: PhaseService: retry session setup operation on first failed attempt (#556)
commitResults.messageBody:
If SessionSetup fails on the first attempt, due to stale data /
high traffic / etc.., re-attempt to confirm if setup was successful.

commitResults.messageTitle: E2E tests: Fix Phase import (#591)
commitResults.messageBody:
Phase Enum was previously shifted to its own model file
but some imports were not updated in the E2E tests.
Let's fix the imports in the E2E tests.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove automatic profile detection (#583)
commitResults.messageBody:
When running via Electron, the app auto detects profile.json based
on the executable's directory.

Let's remove this feature as it will not be supported on the
main web platform.

commitResults.messageTitle: SessionData: Improve verification (#586)
commitResults.messageBody:
The SessionData verification does not assert (1) if the openPhases
key is defined, (2) if open phases have
their respective repos defined and (3) if the open phases
are recognized by the application.

Let's add these checks to ensure that the app fails early
if the necessary information is not present.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add E2E Testing to GHActions Linux Job (#588)
commitResults.messageBody:
Let's update our GH Actions Workflow to run the E2E Tests
on the Linux Job. E2E Tests  will be carried out on Chrome and
Firefox.

NOTE:
The `webdriver-manager update` command must be run before
executing E2E Tests. Currently this ensures that drivers related
to Firefox are updated to the latest version to work with our
tests. In the future this allows us to test our E2E Tests with the
latest browser drivers.

commitResults.messageTitle: IssueTablesComponent: Fix 'view in web-browser' functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
The 'view in web-browser' functionality in the IssueTables component
does not work. This is because the GithubServiceFactory does not
receive its dependencies in the expected order.

Let's fix this bug by re-ordering the dependencies in the
GithubService provider, such that they match the order of
GithubServiceFactory's parameters.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Production Profiles (#638)
commitResults.messageBody:
Added new profiles for the TIC Module as per the
semester's requirements.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement cached logging capability (#616)
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, users do not have a way to easily retrieve logs generated
by the web application. It is also not possible to retrieve logs from
prior sessions.

Let's cache the app's logs, and allow the user to download them in a
text file.

Log information will be cached on localStorage. It can be
downloaded via a button, on the application header.
The app will save logs for a maximum of 4 sessions.

commitResults.messageTitle: Centralize error handling (#643)
commitResults.messageBody:
Only errors explicitly handled by our application
are logged using the app's ErrorHandlingService
(and thus the LoggingService) while other
runtime errors are deferred to the ErrorHandler
from Angular.

Let's set ErrorHandlingService to be the default ErrorHandler
for the app, so that all errors go through our ErrorHandlingService.
In this way, all errors will be logged.

commitResults.messageTitle: Tester Response: Replace checkbox with radio buttons (#618)
commitResults.messageBody:
In the tester response phase, if the tester agrees with the
team's response, she needs to save the response without modifying
anything else, in order for the agreement to be recorded.

Let's provide a more intuitive method of "agreeing with the
team's response" by using radio buttons that allow the user
to explicitly choose between 'I Disagree' and 'I Agree'.

These radio buttons replace the checkbox control in the
tester response form.

commitResults.messageTitle: E2E Testing: Add test for new bug report creation (#596)
commitResults.messageBody:
To guard against regressions, let's add an E2E test that runs
the app through the entire sequence of steps taken when
creating a bug report.

These are:
- Clicking the 'New Issue' button
- Filling Issue Title + Description
- Selecting Issue Type + Severity
- Clicking Submit
- Verifying that new issue is reflected in the table of issues

When writing E2E tests, if you need to perform
multiple dropdown option selections, please refer
to PR #596 or selectDropDownOption in newIssue.po.ts
for information.

commitResults.messageTitle: ApplicationService: Make `isOutdatedVersion` method private (#512)
commitResults.messageBody: Let's restrict this method's access as it is not used outside the ApplicationService.

commitResults.messageTitle: Session ID: Abstract out logic for generating session ID (#536)
commitResults.messageBody:
Wrap code to generate session ID into its own function such
that AuthService does not call uuid() directly.

commitResults.messageTitle: SessionData: add tests for session validation logic (#566)
Phase enum: Move into separate file(#581)
commitResults.messageBody:
The Phase enum is defined in the same file
as PhaseService.

For better organisation, let's move the
enum definition into a separate file.

Let's also define the SessionData interface
using this enum, so that phase names are kept
consistent.

commitResults.messageTitle: IssueRespondedComponent: Decompose logical expressions into methods (#599)
commitResults.messageBody:
Logic expression for initialising default filter for
IssueRespondedComponent is too long and has no tests. 

Let's
* decompose the logic expression to improve readability 
* add tests for default filter initialisation

commitResults.messageTitle: Add next handler for Observables' tests (#608)
commitResults.messageBody:
Some tests do not supply a 'next' callback, when
subscribing to Observables that are expected to throw
errors. This would cause the test to pass if no
error is thrown.

Let's add next handlers where appropriate so that tests
fail when there is undesired behaviour.

commitResults.messageTitle: Integrate prettier as a formatter (#580)
commitResults.messageBody:
Let's adopt Prettier so we can
easily enforce consistent code formatting
in our project.

To ease the adoption of this tool,
let's adopt Prettier incrementally, starting with
a format of our e2e and unit test code.

commitResults.messageTitle: IssuesRespondedComponent: Decompose logical expressions into methods (#614)
commitResults.messageBody:
IssuesRespondedComponent: Decompose logical expressions into methods

Logic expression for initialising filter for
IssuesRespondedComponent is too long and has no tests.

Let's
* decompose the logic expression to improve readability 
* add tests for filter initialisation

commitResults.messageTitle: ProfilesComponent: Add field validation for custom profiles (#623)
commitResults.messageBody:
The app proceeds silently if the selected profiles.json
does not have a profileName or encodedText field.

Let's:
* Validate profiles during upload and selection of profiles
* Open an error dialog if the profile object is malformed

commitResults.messageTitle: Support uploading video files (#637)
commitResults.messageBody:
Uploading videos is currently not supported.

Let's:
* Allow users to upload videos when filing issues
* Limit the size of videos to 5mb

commitResults.messageTitle: Apply prettier to some missed files (#646)
commitResults.messageBody:
There are some prettier style fixes that were not
committed in recent pull requests.
Let's fix those style issues.

commitResults.messageTitle: Include version number in issues created (#656)
commitResults.messageBody:
We don't have a way of detecting which version of CATcher
was used to create a bug report.

Let's
* Include the CATcher version number in issues created
* Include the CATcher client being used (Desktop or Web)

This information will be stored in a HTML comment
of the form: "Version: {Web|Desktop} vX.X.X".

For example:
- <!--Version: Web v3.3.7-->
- <!--Version: Desktop v3.3.6-->

commitResults.messageTitle: Migrate CI to Github Actions from Appveyor and Travis  (#509)
commitResults.messageBody:
- Migrate CI to Github Actions
- Remove dependency on csv-parse

commitResults.messageTitle: GithubLabel: Refactor methods and add tests
commitResults.messageBody:
The GithubLabel class is used to store label data retrieved
from Github. Internally, it uses regex to extract the category
names of labels. Let's add tests for this class' methods, so that
future changes to the regex can be verified.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix Methods and Tests for GithubEventService (#521)
commitResults.messageBody:
Removes the methods getLastModifiedCommentTime() and getLastModifiedTime() from the GithubEventService class and thus, refactor the reloadPage() method to return an Observable<boolean> to help with testing

Co-authored-by: Anubhav

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor Issue Sorting Logic into Separate Module and Add Tests (#538)
commitResults.messageBody:
Decouples the logic of getSortedData() away from IssueDataTable.ts and moves it into a file, issue-sorter.ts which mainly handles the logic of issue sorting.
Also creates separate methods for the sorting of specific keys to increase readability.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Staging Site Deployment from CATcher repository (#546)
commitResults.messageBody:
It will be useful to deploy a testable version of
CATcher upon every commit to the master branch.

Let's setup GitHub workflows that will
deploy CATcher onto the GitHub Pages of the
CATcher-staging repository, upon every
commit to CATcher's master branch.

This also requires creation of a new Client ID,
(for the staging app's OAuth flow).

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Tests for Phase Service Logic  (#560)
commitResults.messageBody: Adds unit tests for phase.service.ts which handles the logic of the current session and phase with regards to CATcher.

commitResults.messageTitle: AssigneeComponent: add tests (#555)
commitResults.messageBody:
Let's add tests to verify that AssigneeComponent:
- displays a placeholder message when no assignees have been chosen
- emits an event containing the updated issue, when assignees
  are chosen
- displays chosen assignees correctly

To achieve this, let's use Angular's DOM testing utilities
so that we can interact with AssigneeComponent's view
like a real user.

commitResults.messageTitle: LabelService: create custom operator for label synchronisation (#590)
commitResults.messageBody:
The entire sequence of operations used to setup
the user's bug reporting repository is defined explicitly
in a single pipeline in PhaseService.

To improve the readability of this session setup logic,
let's create a custom RxJS operator for the label synchronisation
step.

Let's also add tests for the label synchronisation step, to check:
- all required labels are created when none are present on the repo
- missing required labels are created when repo has some labels
- labels are not created when all required labels are present
  on the repo

commitResults.messageTitle: Tests: Move mock SessionData into constants file (#597)
RepoCreatorService: Create custom operator for verifying repo creation (#612)
commitResults.messageBody:
RepoCreatorService: Create custom operator for verifying repo creation

To improve readability of the session setup code,
let's shift the repo creation verification code into a custom operator
in a new service (RepoCreatorService).

Let's also add tests for this custom operator.

commitResults.messageTitle: RepoCreatorService: Create custom operators for attempting repo creation (#634)
commitResults.messageBody:
To improve readability of the session setup code in PhaseService,
let's shift the phase details verification and repo creation code 
into two, separate custom operators in  RepoCreatorService.

Let's also add tests for these custom operators.

commitResults.messageTitle: Include app version number in header and logs (#659)
commitResults.messageBody:
The app version number is displayed in the page title.
To aid debugging, let's give the version number more
prominence by displaying it on the header
and recording it in the logs too.

Let's move the version number to the AppConfig,
so we have a slightly neater method of accessing the
version number in various services and components.
